definition[0]: an honourable action or activity deserves respect and admiration
example[0]: My father didnâ€™t think acting was an honorable profession.
definition[1]: behaving in a way that is morally correct and shows you have high moral standards
definition[2]: an honourable arrangement or agreement is fair to everyone who is involved in it
definition[3]: used in Britain in the titles of children whose father is a lord and in the titles of judges and Members of Parliament
definition[4]: used in the US when writing to or about a judge or important person in the government
